articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: CAMAS VALLEY — Dust blew as vehicles — ranging from ATVs to bikes to water trucks to highly modified trucks to a drone — gathered to kick off Camas Valley Fun Days.
articles.title: Lifting dirt and spirits at Camas Valley Fun Days

articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Dan Loomis announced he will be running for a second term as Douglas County Clerk in the 2024 election.
articles.title: Loomis announces re-election campaign for Clerk

articles.description: OAKLAND — A 45-year-old man was arrested Friday for his alleged role in the death of Terry Lea Deane in Oakland.
articles.title: Man arrested for murder of Oakland woman

articles.description: Law enforcement knocked down a fire in the center median of Interstate 5, near milepost 119, before firefighters arrived on the scene Friday afternoon.

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office downgraded several evacuation notices surrounding the Tyee Ridge Complex fire Friday. As of Saturday, 129 structures were threatened.
articles.title: Tyee Ridge Complex evacuations downgraded, command turned over to ODF

articles.author: WILL GESCHKE The News-Review
articles.description: The Umpqua Kennel Club began its annual dog show Thursday, bringing dozens of furry friends to the Douglas County Fairgrounds to take part in competitions.
articles.title: Umpqua Kennel Club dog show at fairgrounds

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: When imagining a veterinarian practice, many people think about taking small pets, such as cats or dogs or rabbits, in when they might not be feeling so well. For Dr. Scott Hendy, a veterinarian practice is much more than this.
articles.title: Scott Hendy retires after nearly five decades of veterinary work

articles.description: Roseburg Public Library just put the lid on another record-breaking Summer Reading Program.
articles.title: Summer Reading Program exceeds expectations

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Forest Bridges: The O&C Habitat Project Inc. will host the first in a series of open public meetings on Thursday to share feedback on its Active Conservation management principles and proposals for the O&C lands of Western Oregon.
articles.title: Forest Bridge to hold meeting on active conservation management

articles.author: Mandy Hatfield OSU Extension Service
articles.description: What a wonderful time to live in the Umpqua Valley. There is so much produce available fresh from local sources. My biggest complaint is I don’t have more time to preserve all the bountiful food of the season.
articles.title: Using vinegar to preserve

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: DILLARD — Located between the Dillard Store and First Student bus lot is a small dirt track. This track is one of over 300 USA BMX tracks, and home to the Umpqua Valley BMX Club.
articles.title: A great summer activity: BMX racing

articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: Soaring housing prices combined with relatively stagnant wages over the last decade have contributed to a shortage of affordable housing in the county, according to data recently released by Oregon Housing and Community Services.
articles.title: Housing prices soar, wages not so much, state data shows

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review

articles.title: Greater Douglas United Way giving campaign starts with pancakes, donations
